subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Newbie
msgSnippet: Hello Roger I found that Jerome font is the best available currently.  I am in the process of designing a new font with more logical mappings but it is taking
messageBody:
Hello Roger

I found that Jerome font is the best available currently.  I am in the process of designing a new font with more logical mappings but it is taking a long time to get it right.

When I started out (40 years ago) I learned it just by writing incessantly and reading back what I had written.  I then joined the writing circle with Kingsley Read and that forced me to acquire good writing skills as well as getting regular reading practice.

regards

Moira

Moira O'Brien LIPF
Moira O'Brien Photography

Tel +353 (0)766-153852
Tel: +44 (0)845-527 9190

2009/6/13 rogerlovelock@... <rogerlovelock@...>


A quick question from a newbie.
What is the best way to learn QS - I have downloaded the flashcard file and program. What are the best fonts (ie needed for most existing documents) and what is the best way to map your keyboard to those fonts?

Thanks
